Build a SQL WHERE Clause with Scope Materials

Source: R/data-access_int.R
dot-da_where_clause_get.Rd

Constructs a SQL WHERE clause by appending conditions based on the provided parameters. Additionally, it can include a Common Table Expression (CTE) for scope materials if required.

Usage

.da_where_clause_get(
  .clauses = list(),
  .vtype = NULL,
  .ftype = NULL,
  .material = NULL,
  .salesorg = NULL,
  .scope_matl = FALSE,
  .scope_sorg = FALSE,
  .cm_min = NULL,
  .cm_max = NULL,
  .step_min = NULL,
  .step_max = NULL,
  .lagg_min = NULL,
  .lagg_max = NULL,
  .con = NULL
)

Arguments

.clauses

A list of existing WHERE clauses (character strings). If empty, "TRUE" will be added as the initial condition.

.material

Character vector. A list of materials to filter on. If NULL, no material-based filter is applied.

.salesorg

Character vector. A list of sales organizations to filter on. If NULL, no sales organization-based filter is applied.

.scope_matl

Logical. If TRUE, restricts the query to materials within the scope definition using a CTE.

.scope_sorg

Logical. If TRUE, restricts the query to sales organizations within the scope definition.

.cm_min

Character. Minimum calendar month (format: YYYYMM). If NULL, no lower bound is applied.

.cm_max

Character. Maximum calendar month (format: YYYYMM). If NULL, no upper bound is applied.

.step_min

Numeric. Minimum step value to filter on. If NULL, uses a default package-defined constant STEP_MIN.

.step_max

Numeric. Maximum step value to filter on. If NULL, uses a default package-defined constant STEP_MAX.

.lagg_min

Numeric. Minimum lag value to filter on. If NULL, uses a default package-defined constant LAGG_MIN.

.lagg_max

Numeric. Maximum lag value to filter on. If NULL, uses a default package-defined constant LAGG_MAX.

.con

A database connection object. Required for safely parameterizing SQL queries using glue::glue_sql.

Value

A character string representing the SQL WHERE clause.

Details

This function constructs a SQL WHERE clause by:

  1. Ensuring that the initial condition is "TRUE" if no clauses exist in .clauses.

  2. Appending conditions for .material, .salesorg, and scope definitions (.scope_matl, .scope_sorg).

  3. Adding conditions for calendar month (.cm_min, .cm_max), step values (.step_min, .step_max), and lag values (.lagg_min, .lagg_max).

  4. Optionally constructing a Common Table Expression (CTE) for scope materials if .scope_matl = TRUE.

Scope-based filters are applied using pre-defined Common Table Expressions (CTEs).

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Build a basic WHERE clause
where_clause <- .da_where_clause_get(
  .material = c("MAT001", "MAT002"),
  .salesorg = c("SORG001"),
  .scope_matl = TRUE,
  .cm_min = "202101",
  .cm_max = "202312",
  .step_min = -100,
  .step_max = 100
)

print(where_clause)
} # }
